Job Description:
•	Design overall system and solution architecture, system integration, and implementation strategy. 
•	Architect, develop, test and deploy PHP, MySQL, HTML5, Wordpress, Magento applications across platforms within agreed budgets and time frames. Deliver technical design for the solution to be developed. Ensure design and architecture is of high quality achieving necessary design and systems security standards. Ensure developments, enhancements and project outcomes best leverage existing system investment and manage cost of ownership going forward.
•	Lead (planning, control and reporting) all aspects of the SDLC to ensure their effective performance and high quality to agreed budget and timelines including feasibility of the project, provides scoping & estimates, defining a project or problem (functional / non-functional business requirements), architecture & design and all aspects of testing. 
•	Lead and mentor the Software Engineering team. Act as the primary technical contact, provide coaching, mentoring & guidance to all members of the Software Engineering team.
•	Prepare detailed analyses, plans, diagrams and procedures within a technical design document for existing and proposed web applications and system integration.
•	Work closely with all stakeholders including End-Users, Project Managers, Creative Directors, Software Engineers and Account Executives to ensure successful delivery of projects
Job Requirement:
•	Good English Communication is essential
•	Bachelors Degree in Computer Science or equivalent field
•	Be conversant with emerging technologies
•	Manage requirements definition effectively in the face of unclear business requirements 
•	Juggle multiple priorities, including urgent support at critical times such as project delivery
•	Positive working attitude, able to work alone and as a team, good problem solving skills, hardworking
•	Excellent communication and good interpersonal skills
•	Minimum 5 years of overall development experience; 3+ yrs team lead experience with a development team
•	Skills
o	PHP, MySQL, HTML, XML, XSLT, JavaScript, n-Tier design
o	Candidates must have experience developing Interactive Web projects
o	Knowledge of multiple technologies including but not limited to PHP, HTML, CSS, DHTML, XML, SOAP, Java Script, AJAX, Visual Basic, Visual Basic.NET
o	5+ yrs in PHP, MySQL, HTML, CSS
o	4+ yrs in a Database platform
o	2+ yrs Ajax

For any inquiries, pls contact by email.

Company Profile:
Welcome to Aplus Group

We welcome you to Aplus Consulting, considered Cambodia’s most sort after human resource partners. Established in 2008 to provide human resource and tax solutions to local and international companies in Cambodia. Our young and dynamic company has experienced significant growth and now partners with more than 100 organisations, with almost 1,000 employees placed throughout the country.1

We have built a strong team of highly qualified and experienced local and international professionals, bringing their knowledge and expertise of legal, accounting, employee migration, talent acquisition and human resource management and development. We measure our own success from the trust our clients continue to place in us to provide sustainable support services and to grow their human potential.

We sustain the heart we bring to business with our commitment to community development. We partner with universities, scholarship programs and village education to support the academic advancement of young Cambodians. We demand a lot from our team and we commend them for the extra mile they go to volunteer their time, providing on call support for village to city migrating students and  preparation for work  advice and coaching.

We sincerely thank our team, our partners, our clients for helping us to reach a stage where we can proudly hold up SME1 Asia Awards 2012. We promise to only get better at our work and our services for our sustainable success for all.
Contact Info: Contact Information Ms. Long Sochenda  069 477 236/ 078 202 333 KT 4 floors, # 23, street 112, sangkat Phsar Depo 3, Khan Toul Kork, Phnom Penh.  069 477 236/ 078 202 333

Job Description:
- The Teacher shall lead educational play activities inside and outside the classroom and tend to the daily needs of children as well as supervising assigned team/individuals.
- The Teacher shall provide conceptual and professional advice and support for strengthening Color Kids International School Preschool programs/projects and further, support internal and external networking 

Duties: 

- Delivering interesting and motivating lessons as specified in the curriculum 
- Writing weekly lesson plans and making 
- Creating periodic assessment/evaluation materials for students and writing reports of students academic and social progress
- Supporting and facilitating access to quality education for all learning programs.
- Teach extracurricular activities as stipulated by the school
- Engaging parents in their child’s educational development
- Be responsible for the classroom administration and management
Job Requirement:
- Foreign Teacher (Native English Speaker preferred)
- Excellent spoken and written English communication skills 
- Degree in Education and Early Childhood Learning is an advantage
- Extensive teaching (preschool) and childcare experience
- Excellent knowledge and understanding of child development and ethical commitment to child development and safety
- Strong commitment to working in an  international educational environment
- Very good in organizational skills
- Possess a high level of flexibility, adaptability, transparency, and enthusiasm
- Ability to generate additional teaching materials for his/her classroom and outside classroom learning activities.
- Friendly, patient, sensitive, and honest
- Competitive salary based on qualifications and experience(1000–1200 USD per month)
Company Profile:
Color Kids International School (CKIS) is a small, developing pre-school and elementary designed for early childhood education of 21st century and is currently providing a promised international curriculum to Cambodian and local expat children in Phnom Penh. Our team is composed of a well-trained and experienced native expat and local staff with diverse backgrounds in Early Childhood Education, Child Psychology, Child Nutrition, Teaching English as Second Language, Clinical Social Work, Communication Studies and work with children who has special needs education from USA, Europe and Asia. Between school leaders and staff, CKIS has over 40 years of experience educating children and providing child care service. 

CKIS is offering daycare and educational play service for children as you as 1 year to 12 years of age and CKIS is a safest, fun learning environment for every kids and play, learn and grow are our attention the most.  

CKIS is a cross cultural environment where director, teachers, staff and kids can work together and interact with each other freely throughout the day and this creates a joyful learning environment on professional level and personal level.

In the process to become FIRST TRILINGUAL Day Care, Preschool and Elementary, we are looking for candidates who have extensive experience in teaching or leading educational play activities to join our dynamic team.

Job Description:
- Check all the documents for application and credit information collected by Credit Officer before or after field check

- Call Human Resource (HR) staff of lessee’s company to verify employment of lessee, salary, position and period of employment

- Provide an exact information concerning application to Senior Underwriter or Supervisor with all documents for application as needed
- Inform the result of management validation (approve or reject) to POS
- Report status of operation and its problem to Senior Underwriter and get the instruction
- Do cooperate with another department to make process smoothly
- Other duties are assigned from Management if it is necessary and urgent.
Job Requirement:
- At least Bachelor Degree in Finance, Banking, or other related fields
- Understanding in Micro-Finance, Banking, Credit 
- Good commend in English language (Speaking, Writing and Listening)
- Be honest, team work, and good communication skill

Company Profile:
Welcome to Aplus Group

We welcome you to Aplus Consulting, considered Cambodia’s most sort after human resource partners. Established in 2008 to provide human resource and tax solutions to local and international companies in Cambodia. Our young and dynamic company has experienced significant growth and now partners with more than 100 organisations, with almost 1,000 employees placed throughout the country.1

We have built a strong team of highly qualified and experienced local and international professionals, bringing their knowledge and expertise of legal, accounting, employee migration, talent acquisition and human resource management and development. We measure our own success from the trust our clients continue to place in us to provide sustainable support services and to grow their human potential.

We sustain the heart we bring to business with our commitment to community development. We partner with universities, scholarship programs and village education to support the academic advancement of young Cambodians. We demand a lot from our team and we commend them for the extra mile they go to volunteer their time, providing on call support for village to city migrating students and  preparation for work  advice and coaching.

We sincerely thank our team, our partners, our clients for helping us to reach a stage where we can proudly hold up SME1 Asia Awards 2012. We promise to only get better at our work and our services for our sustainable success for all.

Job Description:
ELT is now seeking applications from suitably qualified candidates for the following positions: 
Positions:
1. Native English Teachers 
2. Cambodian English Teachers (Kindergarten and Adult) 
3. Teacher Assistants
4. Primary and Secondary School Teachers
5. Computer Teachers
6. Head Teacher 
7. University Lecturers "Business"

- Native English Teachers: 
English Teachers will be responsible for quality teaching at ELT Institute. He/she must follow the school curriculum and act as a student coach or counselor by helping students meet their learning objectives. The outcomes of this position are expected to be: (1) Meeting student learning objectives; (2) creating a positive and enjoyable learning environment (3) Good public image. 

- Cambodian English Teachers : 
English Teachers will be responsible for quality teaching at ELT Institute. He/she must follow the school curriculum and act as a student coach or counselor by helping students meet their learning objectives. The outcomes of this position are expected to be: (1) Meeting student learning objectives; (2) creating a positive and enjoyable learning environment (3) Good public image. 

- Teacher Assistants
Teacher assistants will be responsible for assisting teacher in the class related to observing, recording and charting students’ behaviors. Moreover, Teacher assistants have to work closely with class teachers and students in order to keep better educational services. 

- Note: All positions above are open to Cambodian and non-Cambodian nationals. Remuneration and benefits will be commensurate with qualifications and experience.
Job Requirement:
1.Native English Teachers:
- Teaching experience in EFL/ESL settings
- Holders of TESOL, TEFL, or CELTA certificates arepreferred
- University degree in any field is preferred

2.Cambodian English Teachers (Kindergarten-Adult):
- Bachelor Degree
- At least 1 years teaching experience 
- Fluent in English/Office Skills and excellent interpersonal skill with strong commitment

3.Teacher Assistants:
- At least graduated from high school (grade 12)
- Upper-intermediate level of English language
- Enjoy being a round with young kids or children
- Be courteous, kind, responsible, flexible, honest, hard-working....

4. Primary and Secondary School Teachers
- Bachelor Degree
- At least 1 years teaching experience 
- Fluent in English/Office Skills and excellent interpersonal skill with strong commitment

5. Computer Teachers
- Bachelor Degree
- At least 1 years experience
- fluent in English and excellent interpersonal skill with strong commitment.
- Able to use photoshop, correaldraw, Autocad,..Design Application

6. Head Teachers
- Bachelor Degree 
- At least 1 years teaching experience
- Fulent in English / office skills and excellent interpersonal skill with strong commitment

7. University Lecturers "Business"
- Master Degree 
- At least 1 years teaching experience
- Fulent in English / office skills and excellent interpersonal skill with strong commitment

Company Profile:
THE LION GROUP was established in the 1930s and today, has operations in Malaysia, China, Singapore, Indonesia, Vietnam, Hong Kong, Cambodia, Myanmar, Sri Lanka, USA and Mexico. It is involved in the retail, property development, mining, steel, agriculture and computer sectors. Since 1992, the Group has ventured into China with operations in the retail and property businesses.
The Group has five companies listed on Bursa Malaysia with three in Singapore, two in Indonesia and one in Hong Kong. It has an annual group turnover of approximately RM 20 billion (US$ 6.6 billion) and provides employment for more than 24,000 people.
Contact Info: Contact Information Wilson Lee   Phnom Penh Tower, Level 13A, Monivong Blvd

Job Description:
- Report to the Resident Engineer (RE)

- To assist the RE on site coordination work with contractors, design/drawing discrepancies with consultant

- To carry out regular site inspection/testing on work done by contractor and work certification with external consultant

- To assist the RE on RFI, NCR, & EI matters

- To assist the RE on construction work progress monitoring

- To attend the regular site meeting

- To assist the RE/PM on liaison with local authorities and site related matters
Job Requirement:
- Bachelor degree from recognised university/ higher 

- technical institute in mechanical and electrical discipline 

- Minimal 3 years experience in construction industry. Those who have past working experience with foreign contractors will have added advantages 

- Able to understand/ interpret drawing
Proficiency in Autocad and Microsoft Office
Proficiency in Khemar and English (writing and speaking)

- Willing to work overtime and night shift.

Job Description:
Summary of position
Our Client is a well-established English training institution focusing on international standard qualities which will expect to open up in 2014 in Cambodia. 
The Accounts Administrator is based in Phnom Penh Office will be responsible for:
Main Duties and responsibilities
•	General Accounting : Administration of accounting documents to ensure all documents are completed and get approval from authorized people 
•	Prepare tax declaration and other similar payment process 
•	Accounts payable/ Accounts receivable: Process payment, report expense and record all transaction in to the system 
•	Check bank statement, control and follow up invoices and receipts 
•	Receive payment, issues receipt, deposit and withdraw money from the bank 
•	Deal with team work related to accounting policy and procedure 
•	File and maintain document in proper file management system 
•	Using accounting system to complete the tasks 
•	Assist all accounting and admin tasks 

Reporting
•	To CEO
Job Requirement:
•	Bachelor degree in Accounting/Finance or relevant qualification
•	At least 5 years proven work experiences in this field
•	Be able to use accounting system (quick book or other accounting system)
•	Knowledge of accounting procedure and formats
•	Have good computer skill (Microsoft office, internet and email)
•	Honest, reliable, hardworking, and high responsibility, and good in problem-solving Fluent in English

Job Description:
Interior designers plan the design of living and commercial environments. They then manage the work of turning their ideas into a reality. They need to design a space that is practical for its purpose as well as visually pleasing.

Projects can be broad in scope, ranging from structural alterations to the choice of furnishings, curtains, wallpaper and lighting. The role includes:

working to a brief, which details what the space will be used for
inspecting and surveying buildings
negotiating fees and setting schedules for the project
researching and drawing up rough plans
developing detailed designs and choosing materials
supervising the work as it is carried out.
Job Requirement:
Excellent in 3D Max Design
Adobe Photoshop
Autocad
Microsoft Excel
Other software related for Interior Design
Can communicate in English
Must live near in our Office Address

Company Profile:
Canadia Bank Plc. was established on 11th November 1991 as “Canadia Gold & Trust Corporation Ltd.”, joint-venture between Cambodian - Canadians and the National Bank of Cambodia (Central Bank of Cambodia). The bank’s management consisted of former staff of the National Bank of Cambodia and its Cambodian – Canadian shareholders.

The main activities were based on gold transactions, gold plaque manufacturing and lending to local merchants. On 19th April 1993 the name was changed into CANADIA BANK LTD., licensed as a Commercial Bank with the National Bank of Cambodia and registered with the Ministry of Commerce. On 16th December 2003 the name of the bank changed into CANADIA BANK PLC. (Public Limited Company).

Since privatization in 1998 the Bank has become the largest local bank in Cambodia. With a worldwide network of correspondent banking relationships and a solid base of local and international customers CANADIA BANK PLC holds commanding market shares in loans as well as deposits. The bank offers a wide range of financial services through its Head Office and its more than 50 branches in Phnom Penh and major cities throughout the country.
Contact Info: Contact Information HR Recruitment Officer  023 868 222 No. 315, Ang Doung St. Corner Monivong Blvd, Phnom Penh, Cambodia.  023 868 222

job title: Head of Tax and Compliance Unit
position: Head of Tax and Compliance Unit
Job Description:
1. Prepare and declare monthly tax reports to general tax department
•	Check salary & benefits tax which sent from HR Department make sure it is accurate and compliant to tax law
•	Ensure withholding tax on rent, interest expense and expenditure of service  providers are withheld correctly
•	Make sure monthly minimum tax on profit is properly calculated by branches and head office
•	Prepare a monthly consolidated tax report and declare it to general tax department (GTD) on time after get approval from CFO and CEO
•	Coordinate with external tax consultant on annual profit tax return
•	Work closely with tax department regarding tax issues
2.	Produce and declare annual tax on profit (ToP)
•	Keep filing of taxation for annual tax on profit (ToP) regularly and accurately
•	Response for completing the annual tax forms from GTD and submit to CFO and CEO for their approval
•	Declare annual ToP to GTD with proper time line 
3.	Responsible for the company’s tax compliance
•	Oversee all financial transactions and reporting systems, ensuring compliance with appropriate law on taxation and regulatory requirements
•	Advise CFO on tax tactics and measurement
4.	Assist to provide technical support and training
•	Providing of technical tax support to branches and departments
•	Developing and updating of tax tools and materials for training
•	Conducting of training for finance team regularly
-	Assist CFO to update tax policies and procedures
Company Profile:
Cambodia Post Bank Plc. (CP Bank) is a full licensing commercial bank, offering financial solutions to aspiring individuals and enterprises in Cambodia. CP Bank is a strategic partnership between Canadia Investment Holding Plc., Cambodia’s Ministry of Post and Telecommunications and Fullerton Financial Holdings Pte. Ltd. Opened in September 2013, CP Bank offers its customers a suite of loan and deposit products, as well as remittance and FX services, for their personal and business needs. With a clear strategic direction and long term commitment, in a few years ahead, CP Bank will expand the branch network to more than 100 branch offices across Cambodia.

We recognize our greatest asset is our people. That is why we are creating a unique climate of inspiration, leadership and great opportunities that will enable the best in market to thrive a part of our diverse team. 

To support our growth for 2015 with the expansion of more than 40 branches network and more than 1300 employees, we are now looking for recruiting customer-oriented and motivated individuals for the following positions to join us in our journey to grow our business and people.

Company Profile:
Tata International Limited [TIL], is the global trading and distribution company of the Tata group. Established in 1962, TIL’s key business lines are leather and leather products, metals trading, minerals trading, distribution (auto and allied) and agri trading. The company operates through its network of offices and subsidiaries across 40 countries, spanning Africa, Europe, Middle East, Latin America and Asia and has spearheaded forays into new geographies for the group.  

Over the years, TIL has formed strong strategic alliances and partnerships that have reinforced its role in international trade and business. With a turnover of USD 1.2 billion (2012-13), the company is supported by a 7500+ strong employee base. 

The company is deeply committed to being a proactive and responsible member of the community and the environment in which it operates. Stringent goals for the reduction of our carbon footprint and greenhouse gases in the leather plant and other facilities, coupled with initiatives for empowering local communities in equal measure, drives the company's long term sustainability agenda. Winner of several prestigious national awards and International certifications for Environment and Quality, it is also a signatory to the UN Global Compact.

Job Description:
Rachana loves music. She doesn’t bring her dancing and singing to work, but she does bring her unique charm and passion for sharing personal experiences to everything she does. 
InterContinental Phnom Penh looks for people like Rachana: charming, confident, sophisticated and internationally-minded people who do all they can to exceed guest expectations.
The InterContinental Phnom Penh is located in the central business district of Phnom Penh and we now have a range of different opportunities at our hotel.
Job Requirement:
Ideally, you will have at least 1 year of experience in the same capacity or in a similar role, with relevant college qualifications. 

You must be able to work flexible hours and spoken and written proficiency in Khmer and English is a must. 

In return, we’ll give you a competitive salary and benefits package, hotel discounts worldwide and opportunities to learn new skills and grow your career. You’ll join a team passionate about delivering memorable experiences that make our guests feel special, making InterContinental Phnom Penh a great place to work. Most importantly, we’ll give you Room to be yourself.

If this sounds like the perfect move for you or if you want to find out more, visit www.ihg.jobs. Get in touch and tell us of your interest by submitting your letter of application and your most updated CV via careers@icphnompenh.com
Or you can drop your CV at our HR Office from Monday to Friday – 08:00am to 5:00pm, Saturday-08:00am to 12:00 noon
www.intercontinental.com

Job Description:
Vacancy Type:Work Experience:1Age:25 Smile Retail Group is a company experienced in convenience store retailing, specializing in minimarts.  Our aim is to offer our customers a wide selection of products in a comfortable, clean shopping environment and the highest levels of customer service.  We are continuing to expand; therefore we are seeking suitable candidates that match well with our company values.   

We currently have the following position to fill.   


Loss & Prevention (L.P.) Supervisor.     The successful candidate will be responsible to minimize losses to the company due to expired or damaged products, inefficient procedures and both internal & external theft of property belonging to the company, its employees, or its customers.  Achieving this will entail a mix of office work checking and analyzing reports, in addition to visiting and inspecting stores on a regular basis.  

The Loss & Prevention Supervisor will have one L.P. staff to assist with monitoring cameras, stocktakes and inventory control.  Although the main role of this position is NOT a security role, the L.P. Supervisor will be also responsible for recruiting and setting the schedule for the team of security guards. 

Duties included are creating computer reports in excel to identify irregular patterns, organizing stocktakes and ensuring stock balances correctly, cross checking reports and cash balances of store supervisors, checking store video cameras for employee violations and shoplifting, occasionally processing staff or customers caught stealing, making sure all equipment is in working order and updating the asset register of company equipment.
Job Requirement:
Loss and Prevention Supervisor
-	University Graduated
-	Extremely reliable, mature and responsible character
-	Very good command of English and Khmer
-	Attention to detail
-	Ability to identify problems and implement solutions
-	Available full time
-	Have own transportation
-	Experience in inventory control preferred, but not essential.  Training will be provided
Contact Info: Contact Information Mrs. Pat Phary  023 21 28 64 Phnom Penh  023 21 28 64

Job Description:
Deloitte is a globally recognized, U.S.-based professional services organization with a business practice devoted to promoting economic development and poverty reduction in emerging markets. For more than 25 years, Deloitte’s Emerging Markets practice has worked with governments, donor agencies, NGOs and private firms in over 60 countries to build the institutions, legal framework, and policies required for effective public and private sector growth.

Deloitte Consulting LLP is currently seeking a Chief of Party for the anticipated five-year, USAID-funded Civil Society Support Contract (CSSC) in Cambodia. The program aims to empower and connect segments of Cambodian civil society for a more influential role in the country’s transformation to an enduring democratic and prosperous country. The program will focus on strengthening the effectiveness of civil society organizations (CSOs) to improve government responsiveness and accountability to Cambodian citizens and the long-term needs of the nation, including protection of human rights. CSSC will: 1) provide administrative and program support to USAID/Cambodia for management of CSO grantees; 2) strengthen organizational capacity of targeted CSOs through a combination of training, customized technical assistance, and ongoing mentoring services; 3) administer financial and technical assistance for grant recipients and manage a grants portfolio to support various initiatives; 4) develop and manage a legal defense fund; and 5) target and capitalize on opportunities for institutional reform.

The Chief of Party will oversee all aspects of the CSSC project and lead the team, including overall strategic vision and management for the program, with responsibility for ensuring all objectives are met. He/She will be responsible for liaising with civil society groups, local government officials, other donors, and other organizations.

Company Profile:
Welcome to Aplus Group

We welcome you to Aplus Consulting, considered Cambodia’s most sort after human resource partners. Established in 2008 to provide human resource and tax solutions to local and international companies in Cambodia. Our young and dynamic company has experienced significant growth and now partners with more than 100 organisations, with almost 1,000 employees placed throughout the country.1

We have built a strong team of highly qualified and experienced local and international professionals, bringing their knowledge and expertise of legal, accounting, employee migration, talent acquisition and human resource management and development. We measure our own success from the trust our clients continue to place in us to provide sustainable support services and to grow their human potential.

We sustain the heart we bring to business with our commitment to community development. We partner with universities, scholarship programs and village education to support the academic advancement of young Cambodians. We demand a lot from our team and we commend them for the extra mile they go to volunteer their time, providing on call support for village to city migrating students and  preparation for work  advice and coaching.

We sincerely thank our team, our partners, our clients for helping us to reach a stage where we can proudly hold up SME1 Asia Awards 2012. We promise to only get better at our work and our services for our sustainable success for all.

Job Description:
INTERCONTINENTAL PHNOM PENH

Rachana loves music. She doesn’t bring her dancing and singing to work, but she does bring her unique charm and passion for sharing personal experiences to everything she does. 
InterContinental Phnom Penh looks for people like Rachana: charming, confident, sophisticated and internationally-minded people who do all they can to exceed guest expectations.
The InterContinental Phnom Penh is located in the central business district of Phnom Penh and we now have a range of different opportunities at our hotel.
Job Requirement:
Ideally, you will have at least 1 year of experience in the same capacity or in a similar role, with relevant college qualifications. 

You must be able to work flexible hours and spoken and written proficiency in Khmer and English is a must. 

In return, we’ll give you a competitive salary and benefits package, hotel discounts worldwide and opportunities to learn new skills and grow your career. You’ll join a team passionate about delivering memorable experiences that make our guests feel special, making InterContinental Phnom Penh a great place to work. Most importantly, we’ll give you Room to be yourself.

If this sounds like the perfect move for you or if you want to find out more, visit www.ihg.jobs. Get in touch and tell us of your interest by submitting your letter of application and your most updated CV via careers@icphnompenh.com
Or you can drop your CV at our HR Office from Monday to Friday – 08:00am to 5:00pm, Saturday-08:00am to 12:00 noon

www.intercontinental.com
P.O. Box 2288, Regency Square, 296 Mao Tse Toung Blvd. Phnom Penh 3, Kingdom of Cambodia

company_name: 西哈努克港经济特区有限公司
Job Description:
1、负责办公室日常
2、负责各种文件的中柬翻译，来访接待翻译。
3、具有良好的职业道德，诚实、正直，学习能力强，能吃苦耐劳。
Job Requirement:
1、国籍：中国籍、柬埔寨籍                         
2、语言：熟练中文、柬语的听说读写，如会英语更佳。
3、技能：掌握基本的办公软件：excel、word、powerpoint等。
4、能吃苦耐劳，具有较强的团队精神。
Company Profile:
西哈努克港经济特区有限公司是西港特区的开发建设主体。西港特区是为企业走出去实现跨国发展的最佳投资贸易平台，是中国首批国家级境外经贸合作区之一，是首个签订双边政府协定的合作区，也是首个建立双边政府协调机制的合作区。总体规划面积11.13平方公里，首期开发面积5.28平方公里，以纺织服装、五金机械、轻工家电等为主导产业，同时集出口加工区、商贸区、生活区于一体。全部建成后可容纳企业300家，就业人口达8—10万人。
　　西港特区地处柬埔寨王国唯一的国际港口城市——西哈努克市，离西港国际机场3公里, 离西哈努克深水港12公里，连接柬埔寨国内最好的公路——四号国道，离柬首都金边仅210公里，地理位置优越，交通便利。 
　　作为中柬两国间的重要合作项目，西港特区受到了两国领导人及各级政府部门的高度关注，2010年12月13日，两国政府在北京正式签订《中华人民共和国政府和柬埔寨王国政府关于西哈努克港经济特区的协定》，奠定了西港特区的法律地位。2012年6月13日，时任中共中央政治局常委、中央纪委书记贺国强在访问柬埔寨期间与柬埔寨王国首相洪森共同为西港特区揭牌。同时，在双边框架协定下，2012年12月4日，西港特区协调委员会第一次会议在无锡召开，标志双边政府支持推动西港特区发展的长效协调机制正式启动。2014年1月27日，中国商务部部长助理张向晨、柬埔寨发展理事会秘书长索庆达在金边共同主持召开西港特区协调委员会第二次会议，为西港特区的快速发展奠定了良好基础。

　　在两国政府的大力支持下，西港特区发展迅速。目前，西港特区3平方公里区域内已基本实现通路、通电、通水、通讯、排污（五通）和平地（一平）；相应地生产、生活配套设施同步跟进。不仅引入了由柬埔寨发展理事会、商业部、海关、商检、劳工局、西哈努克省政府代表组成的“一站式”行政服务窗口，还引入两家物流清关公司、台湾均辉船务有限公司及柬埔寨加华银行等，为入区企业提供高效、全面的服务；同时，联合无锡商业职业技术学院共同建设西港特区培训中心。培训中心根据入区企业人力资源需求，提供语言培训及技能培训，现已开展了四期培训，成效显著。

　　特区现已引入包括工业、服务行业在内的100家企业入驻，分别来自中国、欧美及日本等国家和地区，81家已生产经营，区内从业人数约12000人。

　　建设中的西港特区以创建一个投资环境优越的国际样板园区，一个充满活力的上市公司，一个生态环境良好的工业化新城镇为战略目标。相信，不久的将来，西港特区必将成为中国境外经贸合作区的成功典范，成为中柬世代友好的象征！
Contact Info: Contact Information Mr. Li  Administration Manager 0766123855 西哈努克市  0766123855

Job Description:
Company: Foodpanda.com 
Title: Customer Service Agent (Full time & part time).
Location: Phnom Penh.
Salary: 250 $ + Bonus based on performance. 
Starting date: ASAP.

Description:
Foodpanda is an online food delivery portal that makes it easy for customers to order food from the best restaurants and get it delivered. Foodpanda operates in more than 30 countries around the world, and is growing quickly.

We are launching in Cambodia! 
As a result, we are seeking highly motivated customer service agents, who will manage customers’ orders on the phone.

Your mission / Responsibilities:
After a quick training on the Foodpanda platform and our customer service methodology, your role will be to: 
- Process customer orders on the phone and transmit it to our restaurant partners.
- Manage any customer query or concern.
- Overall, make our customers happy by providing them with a high standard of service.

Requirements:
- 0-2 years of experience in a customer-centered position.
- Nice, friendly and patient person.
- Excellent oral and written communication skills both in Khmer and English.
- Excellent communication skills on the phone.
- Basic computer knowledge.

We offer full time jobs (7 hours a day, 5 days per week) and part-time jobs (4 hours a day, 5 days per week).

To apply, please send your resume and cover letter at s.madid@foodpanda.com
Job Requirement:
After a quick training on the Foodpanda platform and our customer service methodology, your role will be to: 
- Process customer orders on the phone and transmit it to our restaurant partners.

Company Profile:
Welcome to Aplus Group

We welcome you to Aplus Consulting, considered Cambodia’s most sort after human resource partners. Established in 2008 to provide human resource and tax solutions to local and international companies in Cambodia. Our young and dynamic company has experienced significant growth and now partners with more than 100 organisations, with almost 1,000 employees placed throughout the country.1

We have built a strong team of highly qualified and experienced local and international professionals, bringing their knowledge and expertise of legal, accounting, employee migration, talent acquisition and human resource management and development. We measure our own success from the trust our clients continue to place in us to provide sustainable support services and to grow their human potential.

We sustain the heart we bring to business with our commitment to community development. We partner with universities, scholarship programs and village education to support the academic advancement of young Cambodians. We demand a lot from our team and we commend them for the extra mile they go to volunteer their time, providing on call support for village to city migrating students and  preparation for work  advice and coaching.

We sincerely thank our team, our partners, our clients for helping us to reach a stage where we can proudly hold up SME1 Asia Awards 2012. We promise to only get better at our work and our services for our sustainable success for all.
Contact Info: Contact Information Ms. Phuong Panha  078 817 333 KT 4 floors, # 23, street 112, sangkat Phsar Depo 3, Khan Toul Kork, Phnom Penh.  078 817 333

Job Description:
1.	Process Sponsor Letters and Child Reply Letters in compliance with the partnership standards and step business process requirements.
2.	Review quality of all Child Reply Letters received from the Area Development Program (ADP) before sending to Sponsors/ Support Offices.
3.	Mail out Child Reply Letters (CRLs), Annual Progress Reports (APRs) and Water Festival Cards (WFCs) to Sponsors / Support Offices via Global Mailing Service company and keep track of sending records for verification.
4.	Administer receiving and sending mails out in a way that enables the ADP to have their full turnaround time shared out for Sponsor Letter process and allows sponsors to receive Child Reply Letters within default time of the partnership.
Job Requirement:
1.	Bachelor degree of computer science or marketing
2.	At least one year experience of document processing and data entry.  
3.	English proficiency both written and speaking 
4.	Highly competent in the use of standard office software
5.	Fully able to embrace organizational values and possess a high level of commitment towards the mission of WVC.

job title: Project Coordinator for Economic Development and Agriculture
position: Project Coordinator for Economic Development and Agriculture
Job Description:
1.	Promote community level analysis and planning, with TDF (Transformational Development Facilitator) support, and integrate these into project designs and annual plans. Revise plans in response to reflection and learning from the community and the ADP (Area Development Program) Team.
2.	Prepare and revise annual budgets.
3.	Manage and report on the budget according to donor guidelines.
4.	Write project reports according to LEAP and donor guidelines.
5.	 Ensure gender analysis, Christ-cantered commitment, and child protections are integrated into planning and implementation of projects.
6.	Coordinate with TDFs to ensure and support project implementation that promotes transformational development.
7.	Coordinate and network within and outside of WV to maximize resources utilized.
8.	Monitor project activities and outputs to ensure accountability and achievement of outcomes.
9.	Ensure the community is involved in all stages of monitoring and evaluation, including TDIs, which feed into learning and planning.
10.	Document and disseminate key lessons and strategies to appropriate stakeholders.
11.	Participate in practitioner networks / working groups, as agreed with the ADP manager, to ensure ongoing learning on good practices & sectoral standards relevant to assigned projects.
12.	Actively participate as an ADP Team member in learning, training and spiritual nurture.
13.	Be a witness to Jesus Christ through daily life and work.
14.	Support the TDFs in building community capacities for transformational development.
Job Requirement:
1.	Must understand and agree with WV’s vision, mission and core values.
2.	University degree is preferred (Bachelor degree Of Agriculture or Rural Development).
3.	Minimum 2 years of sectoral/appropriate professional experience
4.	Good interpersonal and communication skills 
5.	Sound experience in project design, implementation, monitoring, evaluation, and report writing
6.	Previous experience in advocacy, community development, food security and networking in an advantage
7.	Competent in written English.
8.	Computer literate; Microsoft Word and Excel.
9.	Must be willing to work within a team.
10.	Willingness to travel and stay overnight at project sites and Own Motorbike.

Closing date is 21 Mar 2014 at 05:00 PM
Company Profile: As member of the World Vision International Partnership, World Vision Cambodia (WVC) is a Christian relief and development organization committed to Working with poor communities, focused on children, to transform lives and Cambodian society through Sustainable development.

Job Description:
1.	Deliver all mails from sponsors and/or support offices to children in a timely and efficient manner.
2.	Ensure appropriate internal control on correspondences is in place and is effectively used.
3.	Monitor, file and send the IL (and family photo) to the sponsor properly as requested by the support office for replacements.
4.	Monitor each new RC and Replacement (Photo, Digital Imaging [DI] files, Introductory Letter [IL] and Child History [CH]) with high quality and in line with the CRS Handbook.
5.	Send Child Reply letters from children to sponsors and/or support offices in turn around time.
6.	Coordinate the process of Gift Notification (GN) with involvement of other ADP staff as per the partnership sponsorship standard and the local sponsorship guideline of World Vision Cambodia.
7.	Monitor and submit updated ILs and family photos as requested by the support office for replacements, or at the time of CH preparation for new registered children.
8.	Review data on Child Regular Visit forms to ensure that information collected is accurate.
9.	Build Capacity of Sponsorship Facilitators (SFs) and the Sponsorship Facilitation Team Leaders (SFTLs) in processing sponsorship task and child protection policy.
10.	Reactivate process and send partnership holds and all CIPs’ drop records to support offices within default time.
11.	Monitor new selection package of RCs are good quality in compliance with the support office requirements, partnership sponsorship standard and local RC selection criteria of World Vision Cambodia.
12.	Prepare and submit monthly management progress reports to ADP manager and Cluster CRS Representative within turn around time.
13.	Maintain, update and back up of database regularly follow by Customer Relations Service handbook standards, and policies.
14.	Assist ADP manager in designing ADP Annual Progress Report Insert.
15.	Work closely with ADP staff to build child participation in the ADP.
16.	Spend appropriate portion of times for monthly visits RCs at the target villages.
17.	Monitor and reflect on the Sponsorship Management Project implementation to achieve output.
18.	Ensure each child folder contains related documents to certify the identity of child.
19.	Coordinate and respond to sponsors/SOs inquiries or special requests based on the Customer Relations Service Handbook standards, policies and guidelines of WV ministry.
20.	Ensure that there is no registered child with multiple sponsorships.
21.	Ensure that sufficient supplies for sponsorship business are available in the ADP office.
22.	Assist ADP Manager in preparing annual budget, annual plan of action related to CRS.
23.	Coordinate and process the 2 special mailings (Annual Progress Report [APR] and Water Festival Card [WFC]) to meet the partnership standards.
24.	Coordinate, host and manage Sponsor visit’s arrangement between Support Office and ADP.
25.	Liaise with Children in Especially Difficult Circumstances (CEDC) Program personnel for support and advice.
26.	Coordinate with ADP Team to process Biannual Child Count based on CRS Standard and guideline.
27.	Train ADP staff and community members on child rights and child participation.
28.	Liaise with stakeholders to build good relationship and seek solutions to educational issue, child protection within the ADP.
29.	Develop and file child rights and child protection issues properly.
30.	Prepare and send Child Death Report and child replacement package to Operation,  NO, and support office within time frame
31.	 Conduct regular coaching with the Sponsorship Facilitators and the Sponsorship Facilitation Team Leaders to review job performance.

9.	hardware/software are required.

Job Description:
1. Cashiering
1.	Collects disbursement vouchers from cashier and encode CPR# to keep track of daily cash payments.
2.	Maintains accounting records for all vouchers and certify the correctness of the Daily Cash Reconciliation.
3.	Coordinates with N.O cashier to withdraw cash funding for project expenditures on a weekly basis.
4.	Collects and consolidates the monthly cash request from the projects and submit to Finance Officer for review.
5.	Daily issues cash to Cashier, conduct cash count, check and approve working cash, prepare vault cash sheet and monitor cash inflow and outflow, ensure the security for banking, check the accurate calculation of interest earned from bank accounts.
2. Funding
1.	Prepares monthly cash request and coordinate with project managers in preparing cash forecast.
2.	Performs monthly Funding reconciliation with National Office.
3. Processing/Card forms/Quotation/Purchase Order
1.	Processes card forms from project prior to the payment to ensure sufficient supporting documents attached and compliance with Stewardship Manual and other grant guidelines.
2.	Prepares and reviews CARD forms for adjustment entries.
3.	Coordinates to get quotations with project staff.
4.	Reviews payroll computation.
4. Sun System Encoding & Processing
1.	Gathers and batch processed CARD Forms, and sign the control batch header .  
2.	Encodes entries, initials, indicates held journal number.
3.	Logs in held journal numbers, CARD Form numbers and initials.
4.	Prints out held journal per batch.
5. Reporting Functions
1.	Ensures coding on voucher for valid account, cost center, donor, etc and make an adjustments if necessary.
2.	Prints out monthly Account Listing, Journal Listing, Detail Transactions, etc. for review and office file.
3.	Prints out Trial Balance and other schedules for office file.
4.	Set up Sun System financial report if necessary.
5.	Coordinates with Finance Officer to prepare project and donor financial reports for various support offices on a monthly and quarterly basis.
6.	Coordinates in the updating of Fixed Asset Listing for project and program at least once a year.
6. Filling System
1.	Files completed CARD Forms in labeled folders/binders.
2.	Maintains folders/binders in filing cabinet or shelves or a safe place.
7. Training/Supporting to Project Manager
1.	Provides orientation on basic preparation of CARD Forms, STW manual to Project Team.
2.	Responds to request from project regarding financial data and advice.
3.	Checks outstanding cash advance to ensure internal guidelines being met.
4.	Follows up individual advance settlement.
Job Requirement:
1.	Strong accounting basis understanding is highly preferable
2.	High school graduate with at least 3 years of related accounting working experience / Bachelor degree in Accounting with at least 1-year related working experience. 
3.	Good English in both writing and speaking
4.	Knowledge of computer skills (Spreadsheet/Accounting software, Sun System familiar is advantageous)
5.	Must be honest and trustworthy
6.	Must understand and agree on WV mission, purposes, procedure, and values
7.	Proficiency in accounting background is highly advantageous

Job Description:
A.	Strategic Leadership of WVC’s Youth Programme
•	Conduct an assessment of existing youth activities to inform the development of the youth strategy and programme 
•	Further develop WVC’s Theory of Change for Youth (which documents our understanding of how we can achieve positive change)
•	Lead the process to develop a WVC Technical Approach for Youth (i.e. a Youth Strategy) that aligns with WVC’s national strategy and with the regional and global strategies of the World Vision partnership.
•	Develop, in partnership with key stakeholders, a strategic implementation plan for the development of WVC’s youth programme to achieve our strategic objectives
•	Oversee an increase in meaningful youth participation in WVC’s youth strategy and programme development
•	Act as a spokesperson for WVC on strategic issues concerning youth empowerment
B.	Technical Programme Design
•	Actively develop and manage a team of technically competent, youth-focused, Cambodian staff (some of whom will be direct reports, and others matrix reports)
•	Identify and mentor staff across the organisation who have youth-focused roles
•	Manage the arrangements by which the IP unit provides quality technical support to project staff for the implementation of youth-focused activities 
•	Ensure compliance with WVC’s Child Protection policies in all youth-focused activities. Ensure that staff undertake all efforts to respond to child protection incidents and raise the awareness of communities about child protection.
C.	Technical Team Management
•	Actively develop and manage a team of technically competent, youth-focused, Cambodian staff (some of whom will be direct reports, and others matrix reports)
•	Identify and mentor staff across the organisation who have youth-focused roles
•	Manage the arrangements by which the IP unit provides quality technical support to project staff for the implementation of youth-focused activities 
•	Ensure compliance with WVC’s Child Protection policies in all youth-focused activities. Ensure that staff undertake all efforts to respond to child protection incidents and raise the awareness of communities about child protection
D.	Representation, Networking and Relationship Building
•	Establish supportive relationships with emerging youth networks in Cambodia
•	Working with the WVC Advocacy unit, ensure that WVC’s advocacy agenda for youth is consistently put across in communications with stakeholders
•	Represent WVC on technical working groups and coalitions focused on youth empowerment
•	Network with other key actors in youth programming in Cambodia, building partnership relationships with other organisations whose strategic focus and values are complementary to World Vision’s
•	Build strong relationships with internal World Vision Support Office partners to increase mutual understanding and develop positive new opportunities to work together for the benefit of young people in Cambodia
•	Participate actively in World Vision’s youth focused communities of practice to learn and share good practice and position WVC as a leader within the WV Partnership in youth programming 
•	Collaborate with Resource Acquisition Unit and other technical managers to develop concept notes and project proposals to secure grants and other private funds for youth programmes or youth interventions in multi-sector projects.
Job Requirement:
1.	Bachelor’s Degree in any of the Social Sciences such as International Development, International Relations, etc
2.	Knowledge of youth empowerment approaches and tools 
3.	Excellent verbal and written English communication skills.
4.	Strong planning, critical analysis, negotiation, problem solving, liaison, and networking skills
5.	At least 3 years experience working in a relief or development or local community context
6.	Proficient in the use of Information Technology, digital media (photographs, video, blogs), social media applications in a youth empowerment context and Computer literate; Microsoft Word and Excel
7.	Able to embrace organizational values towards the mission of WVC

Job Description:
SUMMARY OF POSITION


Our client is a Cultural Organisation that offers young people a way out of poverty by training them to become professional artists and performer. The Progam Coordinator will support and coordinate all the Organisation’s activities and programs. He/She will be based in Battambang.
MAIN DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES


Coordination:
• Coordinate all Organisation’s activities and programs.
• Contribute to program monitoring and evaluation where appropriate.
• Collaborate with Fundraising team on drafting project proposals.

Collaboration:
• Share useful information to HoDs and relevant staff where appropriate.
• Participate in workshops and training.
• Work with Finance Team on budget allocation and control for all projects.

Reporting:
• Synthesize departmental reports and write quarterly and annual activity reports.
• Communicate with key partners and submit project reports to donors.

Meetings: Participate in Development and Program Team meetings.

Reporting
• Report directly to the Development Manager

- Strong reporting skills
- Excellent organizational skills, attention to details
- Problem solving and communication skills, strong presentation skills

- Fluent in English, spoken and written

$400-$500

job title: HR MANAGER (10 years qualified candidates only)
position: HR MANAGER (10 years qualified candidates only)
Job Description:
SUMMARY OF POSITION


Our client is a conglomerates of diverse businesses established in Cambodia and Vietnam, Lao and Myanmar, including engineering & construction, food, automotive and heavy equipment sales and service.
The HR Group Manager is in charge of three entities of the Group with a range of businesses of different sizes and stages of development. The HR support is provided in different ways within these three entities: wide variety of jobs and types of staff; large number of low paid people; Engineers / technical positions; Sales positions; “expatriates” status etc.
The HR Manager is based in Phnom-Penh and is responsible to manage the provision of HR services for the three entities in Cambodia and Vietnam mainly, and for the provision of HR support for the development of some other subsidiaries in other countries (Lao and Myanmar).

MAIN DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES


• Leading the provision of HR Services for the three entities in Cambodia and Vietnam - Operational services such as recruitment, pay and benefits, employee relations, people records, learning & development etc.
• Coaching and supporting a team of three (3) HR Managers in Cambodia (2) and Vietnam:

Job Description:
Description: Sales Executive 

Sales Executive Job Purpose: Builds business by identifying and selling prospects; maintaining relationships with clients.
Sales Executive Job Duties:
•	Identifies business opportunities by identifying prospects and evaluating their position in the industry; researching and analyzing sales options.
•	Sells products by establishing contact and developing relationships with prospects; recommending solutions.
•	Maintains relationships with clients by providing support, information, and guidance; researching and recommending new opportunities; recommending profit and service improvements.
•	Identifies product improvements or new products by remaining current on industry trends, market activities, and competitors.
•	Prepares reports by collecting, analyzing, and summarizing information.
•	Maintains quality service by establishing and enforcing organization standards.
•	Maintains professional and technical knowledge by attending educational workshops; reviewing professional publications; establishing personal networks; benchmarking state-of-the-art practices; participating in professional societies.
•	Contributes to team effort by accomplishing related results as needed.
Job Requirement:
Job Requirements 
 	-Good of speaking and writing in English, Chinese or other language.
- Strong negotiation and solve problem to customer.
- Honest to work independently. 
- At least 2 year experience in sale and marketing. 
- Good in computer skill (Ms word & Ms Excel)

Job Description:
Hongo Tsuji Tax & Consulting was established in Tokyo, Japan in 2002 and has been providing 
accounting and tax services of the highest quality in accordance with the needs of its clients.
Hongo Tsuji Tax & Consulting is one of the largest accounting firms in Japan that offers a variety of 
tax, accounting, and consulting services to corporations and individuals. Because of its expertise and 
recognized status in the accounting industry, Hongo Tsuji Tax & Consulting has provided domestic and 
international business solutions to more than 4,500 clients in Japan.
Its organization, headed by the managing partner, Yoshihiro Hongo, has 7 partners, as well as more than 
550 other employees.
Hongo Tsuji Tax & Accounting (Cambodia) Co.,Ltd., which was established in January 2011, is 
fully-owned subsidiary of Hongo Tsuji Tax & Consulting., providing tax and accounting advisory and 
outsourcing services to mainly Japanese companies operating in Cambodia.

• Communication skill.

Job Description:
• Reservation of hotels rooms and meals in hotels (if any) and follow up on the status to inform overseas clients. 
• Information to Operation department in Phnom Penh and Siem Reap office to book land services (car, bus, boat, flights, bike, etc…), guides and restaurants. 
• Creation of PNR in Topax: input selling price of package and hotel. Cost of hotel must also be input at that time.  
• Input in Topax arrival and departure flights and language selection for the guide. 
• Vouchers: for hotels issued 5 to 3 days prior arrival. Voucher must show the 
correct summer promotion.    
• Invoice: 2 options: 
- Prepayment: proforma invoice is sent to client with confirmation of services.
  For prepayments, invoice must show a due date (one month prior arrival).  
- Credit: invoice is issued at same time as vouchers or latest on arrival date.
ALL INVOICES MUST BE CC TO ACCOUNTING WHEN SENT TO CLIENTS. 
• Follow up prepayment (clients with credit are followed up by accounting):   
one month prior arrival, to remind the client to pay. If no news from client after 2 days, to send a second re minder. After second reminder if no news, to inform accounting who will follow up. 
• Work closely with colleagues from other departments and offices. Help and train new comer team in your department.

job title: Chief of Party, Civil Society Support Program, Cambodia
position: Chief of Party, Civil Society Support Program, Cambodia
Location: Banlung，Banteay Meanchey，Battambang，Bavet，Kampong Cham，Kampong Chhnang，Kampong Speu，Kampong Thom，Kampot，Kandal，Kep，Koh Kong，Kratie，Mondulkiri，Oddor Meanchey，Pailin，Phnom Penh，Poipet，Preah Sihanouk，Preah Vihear，Prey Veng，Provinces，Pursat，Rattanakiri，Siem Reap，Sre Ambel，Stung Treng，Svay Rieng，Takeo，Takhmao
Job Description:
Proposal Summary:  
An anticipated five-year USAID-funded program will focus on strengthening organizational capacity and skills of civil society organizations (CSOs) through training, technical assistance, and financial support. Theprogram also will assist USAID with managing a grants program, managing a legal defense fund, and supporting innovative initiatives in improving government responsiveness and accountability to Cambodian citizens.

Position Summary: 
The Chief of Party will provide overall technical leadership and administrative oversight of the project. 

Responsibilities: 
•   Provide technical and administrative leadership for the entire program, ensuring that all objectives are achieved. 
•   Oversee internal management of the project including the budget and performance monitoring and evaluation.
•   Manage and supervise all project activities, staff, and partners, and have overall responsibility for the successful performance of the project.
•   Maintain effective activity tracking and reporting systems and ensure high quality reporting and deliverables. 
•   Provide technical assistance to program counterparts and grantees in areas of expertise and oversee grants program.
•   Serve as principal liaison with USAID, counterparts and other donors.
Job Requirement:
Qualifications: 
•   Graduate degree (Master's or higher) in international development, political science, or other relevant field. 
•   Minimum five years of experience managing USAID funded projects at the CoP or Project Director level.
•   Minimum ten years of professional experience working on all aspects of civil society strengthening including organizational capacity and skills development, facilitating networking, and promoting effective advocacy. 
•   Familiarity with USAID regulations and experience in systems and office set-up, budgeting, financial management, and grants program management.
•   Directly relevant experience in Cambodia or SE Asia. 
•   Demonstrated leadership and diplomacy skills.
•   Strong communication skills, both interpersonal and written.
•   Fluency in English is required; knowledge of Khmer preferred.


Only candidates who have been selected for an interview will be contacted. No phone calls, please.

To apply: Please visit our website, www.msiworldwide.com
Company Profile: MSI is a Washington, D.C.-based international development firm providing specialized short- and long-term technical assistance. Since its 1981 founding, MSI has grown in size and technical scope, now implementing and managing more than 70 projects worldwide. More than 30 are long-term, many in conflict-prone or fragile states that include Iraq, Afghanistan, Pakistan, and South Sudan. Today, our range of technical expertise includes analytical and field projects in democracy and governance, economic growth, strategic planning, organizational capacity building, health and the justice sector. MSI focuses on helping our local partners foster progress, manage change and improve the effectiveness of development assistance. We expanded our global footprint in 2008 by becoming part of Coffey, a leading geoscience, international development and project management firm, and a publicly traded company on the Australian Stock Exchange. Alongside the international development arm of Coffey, MSI has corporate offices in 17 countries. Together, MSI and Coffey employ more than 2,000 professionals worldwide. job title: Deputy Chief of Party, Civil Society Support Program, Cambodia
position: Deputy Chief of Party, Civil Society Support Program, Cambodia
Location: Banteay Meanchey，Banlung，Battambang，Bavet，Kampong Cham，Kampong Chhnang，Kampong Speu，Kep，Koh Kong，Kratie，Mondulkiri，Oddor Meanchey，Pailin，Phnom Penh，Poipet，Preah Sihanouk，Preah Vihear，Prey Veng，Provinces，Pursat，Rattanakiri，Siem Reap，Sre Ambel，Stung Treng，Svay Rieng，Takeo，Takhmao，Kampot，Kandal，Kampong Thom
Job Description:
Proposal Summary:  
An anticipated five-year USAID-funded program will focus on strengthening organizational capacity and skills of civil society organizations (CSOs) through training, technical assistance, and financial support. The program also will assist USAID with managing a grants program, managing a legal defense fund, and supporting innovative initiatives in improving government responsiveness and accountability to Cambodian citizens. 

**Please note: Only Cambodian citizens are eligible for this position.**

Position Summary: 
The Deputy Chief of Party (DCOP) will support the Chief of Party (COP) in managing all aspects of the program. 

Responsibilities: 
•   Assist the Chief of Party in providing management oversight and technical advice for all program components, and ensure that the overall project is meeting proposed objectives and targets.
•   Supervise and monitor implementation of project activities to ensure quality work and compliance with work plan obligations, timelines, deliverables and results.
•   Provide capacity-building and mentorship to technical specialists and program staff, as needed. 
•   Serve as acting Chief of Party when necessary and in that role represent the project before USAID and project stakeholders.
Job Requirement:
Qualifications: 
•	Master’s or higher degree in political science, public policy or other relevant field.
•	Minimum of ten years’ experience in managing and implementing international donor-funded civil society programs. Experience in managing USAID-funded programs preferred.
•	Thorough knowledge and understanding of civil society development issues in Cambodia.
•	Proved leadership and managerial skills and demonstrated ability to effectively manage staff. 
•	Strong interpersonal skills to maintain good relations with partners, CSO representatives, government officials, USAID, and other stakeholders associated with the program.
•	Professional proficiency in English and Khmer required.


Only candidates who have been selected for an interview will be contacted. No phone calls, please.

To apply: Please visit our website, www.msiworldwide.com
Company Profile: MSI is a Washington, D.C.-based international development firm providing specialized short- and long-term technical assistance. Since its 1981 founding, MSI has grown in size and technical scope, now implementing and managing more than 70 projects worldwide. More than 30 are long-term, many in conflict-prone or fragile states that include Iraq, Afghanistan, Pakistan, and South Sudan. Today, our range of technical expertise includes analytical and field projects in democracy and governance, economic growth, strategic planning, organizational capacity building, health and the justice sector. MSI focuses on helping our local partners foster progress, manage change and improve the effectiveness of development assistance. We expanded our global footprint in 2008 by becoming part of Coffey, a leading geoscience, international development and project management firm, and a publicly traded company on the Australian Stock Exchange. Alongside the international development arm of Coffey, MSI has corporate offices in 17 countries. Together, MSI and Coffey employ more than 2,000 professionals worldwide. For more information on MSI, please visit our website at www.msiworldwide.com.

The program also will assist USAID with managing a grants program, managing a legal defense fund, and supporting innovative initiatives in improving government responsiveness and accountability to Cambodian citizens. 

Position Summary: 
The Monitoring & Evaluation (M&E) Specialist will design and implement an M&E system to monitor the program in reaching its targets and overall objectives.

**Please note: Only Cambodian citizens are eligible for this position.**

Responsibilities: 
•   Design program M&E plan in close communication with MSI home office and with input from program management team.
•   Design and manage M&E system to collect data and review results against established indicators and targets. 
•   Collect data to monitor program results according to the M&E plan and perform data quality assessments.
•   Produce regular M&E reports based on the established schedule and needs.
•   Update, revise, and improve M&E system and plan as needed.
•   Provide training and technical assistance to program sub-grantees and sub-contractors in developing and implementing M&E systems for their programs.
•   Provide input to program planning, reporting and deliverables.  
•   Other responsibilities relative to the position.
Job Requirement:
Qualifications: 
•   Bachelors or advanced degree in statistics, demographics, public policy, international development, economics, or related field. An advanced certificate in M&E preferred. 
•   Minimum of five years of proven successful professional experience in a senior position responsible for implementing M&E activities of international development projects.
•   Knowledge of and experience with the major evaluation methodologies (e.g., qualitative, quantitative, mixed method, and impact) and data collection and analysis methodologies
•   Professional proficiency in English and Khmer required.

Job Description:
• Anticipate changes in the company’s Operating Environment which create commercial risk and competitive opportunity. 
• Ensure anticipated changes, risks and opportunities are communicated in a timely fashion to the Country Manager and members of the market. 
• Develop strategies and programs through which the Operating Environment will be shaped to minimize commercial risk and secure competitive advantage in a responsible, proactive manner. 
• Develop Corporate Philanthropy strategies and programs through which the company will contribute to the community in a meaningful, sustainable manner.
• Direct the development of political, regulatory, and media stakeholder maps which identify the groups or individuals who influence and shape public and government policy and opinion.
• Develop and direct the implementation of political, regulatory, and media engagement strategies to ensure that the company’s positions and views are presented in a timely, effective and consistent manner.
• Establish clear performance criteria and objectives for all Public Relations and Government Relations consultants engaged by the company in the market. 
• Ensure that PR and GR strategies are aligned with the company’s business goals and performance objectives. 
• Ensure that all programs are assessed against agreed performance criteria and objectives, and are in line with the Company Code of Conduct.
• Assist in other C&TM function as requested by Country Manager from time to time as part of incumbent's developmental plan to better appreciate the commercial operating environment.
• The Corporate Affairs and Communications incumbent is expected to develop effective working relationships with the Country Manager and other function heads in market as well as key support functions in Region and Geneva.
Job Requirement:
• University graduate or above, Major in Legal/Politics or its equivalent
• Having a clear demonstration of previous commercial experiences and accomplishments, as a line manager responsible for a function or market is desired. 
• Experience in Corporate Affairs in a market, or in legal training is an added benefit. 
• Multi-year experience in a similar role with a large international company, or a significant local firm, is highly desirable.  
• Candidates who are high performers and have a proven track record in anticipating change in the Operating Environment, and executing strategies and programs to shape change is critical. 
• Excellent interpersonal skills, influential, strong leadership, teamwork qualities and exposure to one or more of Asia’s developed markets are highly desirable.  
• Fluency in both written and spoken English is a must have and the candidate should be articulate, cultured, and well presented.  
• Solid interpersonal skills and cultural sensitivity is a critical requirement.
